results.title: Throwing sports

results.title: Throwing in baseball
results.brief_description: Shows the ins and outs of throwing a baseball following all the procedures of how to “throw” with technique and practice. Takes the viewer through “throwing practice” with its secrets on pitching the “perfect curve ball”.

results.title: Throwing and catching
results.creator_credit: N.E. Sweglar and Visual Information Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”
A coaching film concentrating on how one holds the lacrosse stick and the correct way to throw and catch the ball. Also shows exercises to help you and your team develop your skills.

results.title: Throwing
results.creator_credit: Richard Philps and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Potter”
This film deals exclusively with the use of the potter’s wheel and explains the principles of centring. Various methods of making simple shapes such as a beaker or mug, a jug, a bowl, a dish and a bottle are also illustrated.

results.title: Through the looking glass
results.creator_credit: Jambre Productions and Burbank Animation Sydney (Jointly)
results.brief_description: Alice has fallen through her mirror into a wonderful place called Chessland! There Tom Fool, the plucky magician, introduces her to the eccentric White Queen. Alice wants to be Queen too! However, first she must travel across 8 crazy squares of Chessland hitching rides on flying horses and trains that swim.

results.title: Through the Forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. The Mountain Ash provides food and shelter at all levels. From the forest floor where the lyrebird scavenges to the treetops which provide launch pads for the spectacular sugar gliders

results.title: Through the eyes of Forrest Gump
results.creator_credit: William Rus, Paramount Pictures and Peyton Reed
results.brief_description: ‘Forest Gump’ won audiences over with it’s universal theme of the underdog who triumphs in the face of adversity, carefully intercut with definitive moments in American history. This program provides a behind the scenes look at how director Robert Zemeckis and his team of special effects artist created the illusion of past and present meeting - such as when Forest meets several U.S. presidents, as well as the special effects involved in recreating the anti-war demonstration, the ping pong game, Lt. Dan’s amputated body and the hurricane. Interviews are provided with cast members Tom Hanks, Robin Wright, Gary Sinise, Mykelti Williamson, Sally Field and Michael Humphreys.

results.title: Through the eyes of a child (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A shopping expedition seen from a child’s eye level. The mother’s goal is just to shop but the child wants to savour every experience along the way, unaware of the circumstances which make his mother hurry on.
results.description: A shopping expedition seen from a child’s eye level. The mother’s goal is just to shop but the child wants to savour every experience along the way, unaware of the circumstances which make his mother hurry on.

results.title: Through the eyes of a child
results.creator_credit: Brenda Crowe, CTVC and Chris Petit
results.brief_description: Documentary on early childhood development. How does a child make sense of the world and itself in relation to the world? A mother and her child go about their everyday life: shopping trips, play, all seen through the eyes of the child. Interviews with children and adolescents talking about their earliest memories of developing a relationship with the outside world, their fears and fantasies about the world outside their relationship with their mother. How does a child make sense of things like clothes; everyday objects like a teapot and what it’s for are learned through play. Without commentary, through images we see the relationship of this learning and the bearing it has on relationships developed in adolescence.
